overview: From 2026-01-09 to 2026-01-10, elizaos/elizaos.github.io had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 7 new issues, and 4 active contributors.

topIssues.title: feat: extend grouped org/repo format to day/week/month summaries
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body:
## Summary

PR #193 introduced grouped org/repo format for lifetime summaries to improve readability for contributors with many PRs across multiple repositories.

This issue proposes extending the same format to day/week/month summaries for consistency.

## Current State (verified from code)

**Lifetime summaries** (new format):
```
PULL REQUESTS:
- Merged: 3 PRs:
  - elizaos/eliza (3 PRs): #6197 "fix markdown spacing" (+10/-5), #6202 "migrate SQL plugin" (+50/-10), #6209 "parallel action" (+200/-50)
```

**Day/week/month summaries** (old format with redundant repo names):
```
PULL REQUESTS:
- Merged: 3 PRs: elizaos/eliza#6197 "fix markdown spacing" (+10/-5 lines), elizaos/eliza#6202 "migrate SQL plugin" (+50/-10 lines), elizaos/eliza#6209 "parallel action" (+200/-50 lines)
```

The repo name `elizaos/eliza` is repeated for every PR. This is verified from `aiContributorSummary.ts` line 153:
```typescript
return `${pr.repository}#${pr.number} ...`;
```

## Proposed Change

Apply the same grouped format to all intervals to eliminate redundancy.

## Benefits

1. **Eliminates redundancy** - Repo name appears once per repo, not per PR
2. **Consistency** - Same format across all summary types  
3. **Clearer repo distribution** - AI can see at a glance where work is concentrated
4. **Token efficiency** - Fewer tokens wasted on repeated org/repo strings

## Implementation

Modify `formatContributorPrompt()` in `src/lib/pipelines/summarize/aiContributorSummary.ts`:
- Remove the `intervalType === "lifetime"` condition
- Apply grouped format unconditionally

## Testing

- Generate summaries for various intervals and contributor activity levels
- Verify AI output quality is maintained or improved

topIssues.title: feat: Make character class thresholds configurable
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body:
## Summary

Move character class thresholds from hardcoded values to `config/example.json` for per-deployment customization.

## Current State

Thresholds are hardcoded in `src/lib/pipelines/export/exportLeaderboardAPI.ts`:

```typescript
const types = [
  { key: "prs", name: "Builder", threshold: 50 },
  { key: "issues", name: "Hunter", threshold: 25 },
];
const hasHighReviews = distribution.reviews.percentage >= 25;
```

## Proposed Config

```json
{
  "characterSystem": {
    "thresholds": {
      "builder": { "prs": 50 },
      "hunter": { "issues": 25 },
      "maintainer": { "reviews": 25 },
      "scribe": { "docsFocus": 40 }
    },
    "tiers": {
      "beginner": 0,
      "regular": 50,
      "active": 200,
      "veteran": 500,
      "elite": 1000,
      "legend": 5000
    }
  }
}
```

## Benefits

- Fork-friendly: Different orgs have different contribution patterns
- PM-friendly: No code changes to tune thresholds
- Consistent with existing config patterns (scoring rules, bot exclusions)

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Add characterSystem section to config schema
- [ ] Load thresholds from config in deriveCharacterClass()
- [ ] Update documentation
- [ ] Add example config values

## Related

- PR #193 added documentation noting this as future work

topIssues.title: feat: Allow class respec with history preservation
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body:
## Summary

Allow users to change their class while preserving history for lore.

## Rules

- Respec has a cooldown period (e.g., once per month)
- Previous class is recorded in history
- Lore displays journey: "Once a Builder, now walks the Scribe path"
- Only can respec to classes you qualify for based on activity

## API

```
POST /api/users/{username}/respec
{
  "targetClass": "Scribe"
}
```

Returns error if:
- Cooldown not met
- User doesn't qualify for target class

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Respec endpoint with cooldown check
- [ ] Qualification validation for target class
- [ ] History recording on respec
- [ ] UI for respec on profile page

## Related

- Depends on #194 (Orders & Evolution system)
- Depends on lore recording (#196)

topIssues.title: feat: Add visual identity system for Orders
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body:
## Summary

Each Order gets unique visual identity elements for UI display.

## Order Colors

| Order      | Primary Color | Accent  | Sigil          |
|------------|--------------|---------|----------------|
| Builder    | Blue (#3B82F6) | Steel   | hammer-wrench  |
| Hunter     | Orange (#F97316) | Bronze | crosshairs     |
| Scribe     | Purple (#8B5CF6) | Gold   | book-open      |
| Maintainer | Green (#22C55E) | Silver | shield-check   |
| Machine    | Gray (#6B7280) | Neon    | cpu            |

## API Additions

```json
{
  "characterSheet": {
    "characterClass": "Builder",
    "order": {
      "name": "Builder",
      "color": "#3B82F6",
      "accent": "#94A3B8",
      "sigil": "hammer-wrench",
      "motto": "We build the future"
    }
  }
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Define color palette for each Order
- [ ] Add sigil icons (Lucide icons)
- [ ] Add order metadata to API responses
- [ ] Update profile page with Order visuals
- [ ] Leaderboard badges with Order colors

## Related

- Depends on #194 (Orders & Evolution system)

topIssues.title: feat: Track class evolution history for lore display
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body:
## Summary

Record class transitions for rich profile lore (e.g., "Once a Scribe, now a Maintainer").

## Database Schema

```sql
CREATE TABLE user_class_history (
  id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
  username TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES users(username),
  from_class TEXT NOT NULL,
  to_class TEXT NOT NULL,
  transition_date TEXT NOT NULL,
  reason TEXT -- "evolution", "respec", "tier_up"
);
```

## Profile Display

```json
{
  "classHistory": [
    { "class": "Contributor", "date": "2024-10-15", "reason": "joined" },
    { "class": "Scribe", "date": "2024-11-01", "reason": "evolution" },
    { "class": "Archivist", "date": "2025-01-01", "reason": "evolution" }
  ],
  "lore": "Once a Contributor, evolved through the Scribe Order to become an Archivist"
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Database table for class history
- [ ] Record transitions on class change
- [ ] Generate lore text from history
- [ ] Display lore on profile page

## Related

- Depends on #194 (Orders & Evolution system)

topPRs.title: feat: add MMORPG-style character system to leaderboard API
topPRs.author: madjin
topPRs.body:
Enhance leaderboard API with comprehensive character progression system inspired by Ragnarok Online: ## Phase 1: Enhanced Focus Areas with Rankings - Transform focus areas from simple tags to rich objects with scores, percentages, and global rankings - Add FocusAreaDetail interface with tag, score, percentage, rank, and totalInArea - Calculate global rankings across all contributors per focus area - Show expertise distribution (e.g., "#3 in Frontend out of 45 contributors") ## Phase 2: Lifetime Summary Endpoint - Add /api/summaries/contributors/{username}/lifetime.json endpoint for all-time summaries - Update schema to support "lifetime" interval type in user_summaries table - Create database migration (0014_add_lifetime_interval.sql) - Add --lifetime CLI flag for opt-in generation - Implement generateLifetimeSummary pipeline with all-time metrics ## Phase 3: MMORPG Character Sheet Score Breakdown - Add ScoreBreakdown interface with tier, percentile, characterClass, and distribution - Implement 6-tier progression system: beginner → regular → active → veteran → elite → legend - Calculate percentile rankings showing relative standing among all contributors - Auto-derive character classes from behavior patterns: * Author (PRs ≥50%), Reviewer (Reviews ≥30%), Advocate (Issues ≥25%), Discussant (Comments ≥20%) * Hybrid classes: Maintainer (Author + Reviewer), and dynamic combinations - Show contribution distribution as percentages (Code Author, Problem Finder, Code Reviewer, Discussant) ## Phase 4: User Profile Endpoint - Add /api/contributors/{username}/profile.json endpoint - Query complete character sheet for any user by username - Include ranks across all time periods (monthly, weekly, lifetime) - Provide links to all summaries and resources - Much faster than downloading entire leaderboard ## Technical Changes - Update OpenAPI spec with new endpoints and schemas - Add comprehensive API documentation with example responses - Update CLI to support lifetime interval generation - Export individual user profiles during leaderboard generation - Add .gitignore entry for docs/ folder

Greptile Overview

Greptile Overview

### Greptile Summary This PR implements a comprehensive MMORPG-inspired character progression system for the leaderboard API, adding lifetime summaries, enhanced focus areas with rankings, score breakdowns with tiers and percentiles, character classes, and individual user profile endpoints. ## Key Changes **Phase 1 - Lifetime Summaries**: Added database support and pipeline logic for all-time contributor summaries via new `lifetime` interval type. Contributors can opt-in via `--lifetime` CLI flag. Summaries are stored at simplified paths (`/api/summaries/contributors/{username}/lifetime.json`). **Phase 2 - Enhanced Focus Areas**: Transformed simple tags into rich objects with scores, percentages, and global rankings. Each contributor now shows their rank within each expertise area (e.g., "#3 in Frontend out of 45 contributors"). **Phase 3 - MMORPG Character System**: Added comprehensive score breakdowns with: - 6-tier progression (beginner → legend) - Percentile rankings among all contributors - Auto-derived character classes based on behavior (Author, Reviewer, Maintainer, etc.) - Contribution distribution as percentages **Phase 4 - User Profiles**: New `/api/contributors/{username}/profile.json` endpoint providing complete character sheets with ranks across all time periods, focus areas, achievements, and links to related resources. ## Architecture The implementation follows existing pipeline patterns, extending the summarize and export stages. Database schema properly migrated to support lifetime interval. All enrichment data is fetched in batches and mapped efficiently. Profile generation reuses leaderboard data to avoid duplicate queries. ## Issues Found - **[P0] Critical**: `.gitignore` syntax error prevents `docs/` from being ignored correctly - **[P1] Urgent**: Logic bug in contributor type classification makes "reviewer" type unreachable ### Confidence Score: 3/5 - Not safe to merge without fixes - contains one critical syntax error and one logic bug affecting core functionality - The PR has two blocking issues: (1) a P0 syntax error in .gitignore that will cause the docs/ directory to not be ignored, potentially committing generated files, and (2) a P1 logic error in contributor type classification where the "reviewer" type is unreachable due to incorrect condition ordering. While the overall implementation is well-structured and follows existing patterns, these bugs affect core functionality and must be fixed before merge. - .gitignore (P0 syntax error) and src/lib/pipelines/export/exportLeaderboardAPI.ts (P1 logic bug in contributor classification)

Important Files Changed

File Analysis | Filename | Score | Overview | |----------|-------|----------| | .gitignore | 2/5 | Critical syntax error: missing newline causes docs/ directory to not be ignored correctly | | cli/analyze-pipeline.ts | 5/5 | Added --lifetime flag support with correct opt-in behavior; lifetime excluded from default intervals | | drizzle/0014_add_lifetime_interval.sql | 5/5 | Clean migration adding 'lifetime' to interval_type enum; properly preserves data and recreates indexes | | src/lib/data/schema.ts | 5/5 | Added 'lifetime' to interval type enum matching migration; straightforward schema update | | src/lib/fsHelpers.ts | 5/5 | Added special handling for lifetime summaries with simplified path structure; proper type casting | | src/lib/pipelines/summarize/generateLifetimeSummary.ts | 5/5 | New lifetime summary pipeline with all-time metrics; follows existing patterns correctly | | src/lib/pipelines/summarize/aiContributorSummary.ts | 5/5 | Extended to support lifetime interval using month model as fallback; proper handling added | | src/lib/pipelines/summarize/context.ts | 5/5 | Updated type definitions to include lifetime in enabled intervals; minimal necessary change | | src/lib/pipelines/summarize/index.ts | 5/5 | Integrated lifetime summaries into pipeline sequence; proper destructuring of results | | src/lib/pipelines/export/exportLeaderboardAPI.ts | 3/5 | Major feature additions (MMORPG system, profiles, rankings); contains logic bug in contributor type classification | | public/openapi.json | 5/5 | Added profile endpoint schema and UserProfileResponse definition; comprehensive OpenAPI spec | | src/app/api/page.tsx | 5/5 | Enhanced API documentation with new endpoints and detailed examples; moved to server-side rendering |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant CLI as CLI (analyze-pipeline.ts) participant Pipeline as Summarize Pipeline participant Lifetime as generateLifetimeSummary participant AI as aiContributorSummary participant DB as Database (SQLite) participant FS as File System participant Export as exportLeaderboardAPI participant Profile as User Profile Export Note over CLI,Profile: Phase 1: Lifetime Summary Generation CLI->>Pipeline: summarize --lifetime flag Pipeline->>Lifetime: generateLifetimeContributorSummaries Lifetime->>DB: getAllActiveContributors() DB-->>Lifetime: List of usernames loop For each contributor Lifetime->>DB: checkExistingLifetimeSummary(username) DB-->>Lifetime: exists or not alt Summary doesn't exist or overwrite=true Lifetime->>DB: getContributorMetrics(2020-01-01 to now) DB-->>Lifetime: All-time metrics Lifetime->>AI: generateAISummaryForContributor(metrics, "lifetime") AI->>AI: Use "month" model for lifetime AI-->>Lifetime: AI-generated summary Lifetime->>DB: storeLifetimeSummary(username, date, summary) Lifetime->>FS: Write lifetime.md Lifetime->>FS: writeSummaryToAPI (lifetime.json) end end Note over CLI,Profile: Phase 2: Leaderboard & Profile Export CLI->>Export: exportAllLeaderboardAPIs() Export->>DB: Query userDailyScores with date ranges Export->>DB: getUserWallets(usernames) Export->>DB: getUserFocusAreas(usernames) Export->>Export: calculateFocusAreaRankings() Export->>DB: getUserAchievements(usernames) Export->>DB: computeContributorProfiles(usernames) Export->>Export: Calculate score breakdowns Export->>Export: deriveCharacterClass() Export->>Export: calculateTier() Export->>Export: calculatePercentile() Export->>FS: Write leaderboard-monthly.json Export->>FS: Write leaderboard-weekly.json Export->>FS: Write leaderboard-lifetime.json Export->>Profile: exportAllUserProfiles() loop For each user Profile->>Export: getLeaderboardData (lifetime) Export-->>Profile: User entry with full character sheet Profile->>Profile: getUserRanks (monthly, weekly, lifetime) Profile->>FS: Write /api/contributors/{username}/profile.json end ```

Important Files Changed

File Analysis | Filename | Score | Overview | |----------|-------|----------| | .gitignore | 2/5 | Critical syntax error: missing newline causes docs/ directory to not be ignored correctly | | cli/analyze-pipeline.ts | 5/5 | Added --lifetime flag support with correct opt-in behavior; lifetime excluded from default intervals | | drizzle/0014_add_lifetime_interval.sql | 5/5 | Clean migration adding 'lifetime' to interval_type enum; properly preserves data and recreates indexes | | src/lib/data/schema.ts | 5/5 | Added 'lifetime' to interval type enum matching migration; straightforward schema update | | src/lib/fsHelpers.ts | 5/5 | Added special handling for lifetime summaries with simplified path structure; proper type casting | | src/lib/pipelines/summarize/generateLifetimeSummary.ts | 5/5 | New lifetime summary pipeline with all-time metrics; follows existing patterns correctly | | src/lib/pipelines/summarize/aiContributorSummary.ts | 5/5 | Extended to support lifetime interval using month model as fallback; proper handling added | | src/lib/pipelines/summarize/context.ts | 5/5 | Updated type definitions to include lifetime in enabled intervals; minimal necessary change | | src/lib/pipelines/summarize/index.ts | 5/5 | Integrated lifetime summaries into pipeline sequence; proper destructuring of results | | src/lib/pipelines/export/exportLeaderboardAPI.ts | 3/5 | Major feature additions (MMORPG system, profiles, rankings); contains logic bug in contributor type classification | | public/openapi.json | 5/5 | Added profile endpoint schema and UserProfileResponse definition; comprehensive OpenAPI spec | | src/app/api/page.tsx | 5/5 | Enhanced API documentation with new endpoints and detailed examples; moved to server-side rendering |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant CLI as CLI (analyze-pipeline.ts) participant Pipeline as Summarize Pipeline participant Lifetime as generateLifetimeSummary participant AI as aiContributorSummary participant DB as Database (SQLite) participant FS as File System participant Export as exportLeaderboardAPI participant Profile as User Profile Export Note over CLI,Profile: Phase 1: Lifetime Summary Generation CLI->>Pipeline: summarize --lifetime flag Pipeline->>Lifetime: generateLifetimeContributorSummaries Lifetime->>DB: getAllActiveContributors() DB-->>Lifetime: List of usernames loop For each contributor Lifetime->>DB: checkExistingLifetimeSummary(username) DB-->>Lifetime: exists or not alt Summary doesn't exist or overwrite=true Lifetime->>DB: getContributorMetrics(2020-01-01 to now) DB-->>Lifetime: All-time metrics Lifetime->>AI: generateAISummaryForContributor(metrics, "lifetime") AI->>AI: Use "month" model for lifetime AI-->>Lifetime: AI-generated summary Lifetime->>DB: storeLifetimeSummary(username, date, summary) Lifetime->>FS: Write lifetime.md Lifetime->>FS: writeSummaryToAPI (lifetime.json) end end Note over CLI,Profile: Phase 2: Leaderboard & Profile Export CLI->>Export: exportAllLeaderboardAPIs() Export->>DB: Query userDailyScores with date ranges Export->>DB: getUserWallets(usernames) Export->>DB: getUserFocusAreas(usernames) Export->>Export: calculateFocusAreaRankings() Export->>DB: getUserAchievements(usernames) Export->>DB: computeContributorProfiles(usernames) Export->>Export: Calculate score breakdowns Export->>Export: deriveCharacterClass() Export->>Export: calculateTier() Export->>Export: calculatePercentile() Export->>FS: Write leaderboard-monthly.json Export->>FS: Write leaderboard-weekly.json Export->>FS: Write leaderboard-lifetime.json Export->>Profile: exportAllUserProfiles() loop For each user Profile->>Export: getLeaderboardData (lifetime) Export-->>Profile: User entry with full character sheet Profile->>Profile: getUserRanks (monthly, weekly, lifetime) Profile->>FS: Write /api/contributors/{username}/profile.json end ```
